definition: to make public/to disclose
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes

sentences.english: I heard this from another office, don't make it public.
sentences.chinese: 侧闻此事，你不要声张出去。

sentences.english: This business is hush-hush. Never breathe a word to anyone about it.
sentences.chinese: 这件事可不要声张，千万别向任何人吐露一个字。

sentences.english: Ned: You could tell me who killed you so, y'know, justice can be served.
sentences.chinese: 你能告诉我谁杀了你，然后就，那个，声张正义了嘛。

sentences.english: His sister told on him though he tried to shush her.
sentences.chinese: 尽管他想叫她别声张，可妹妹还是告了他。

sentences.english: We said it privately, but I’ll do it one more time here on the site.
sentences.chinese: 我们对此并不声张，但是我会在这里再做一次。

sentences.english: The government is soft-pedaling the problem of unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 政府不声张失业的问题。

sentences.english: This business is hush-hush. Never breathe a word to anyone about it.
sentences.chinese: 这件事可不要声张，千万别向任何人流露一个字。

definition: to act blindly without thinking (idiom)
timid/to be afraid of getting involved/to be afraid of getting into trouble
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
a new branch grows out of a knot (idiom); fig. side issues keep arising
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
to act recklessly/to mess around
to stir up trouble
to show one's wealth/to let one's wealth show
to divulge secrets
with great fanfare
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
to leak (of information, liquid etc)/to divulge
to create difficulties/to invite trouble/to be troublesome
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
to lay bare (actual facts, secrets etc)/to reveal
